de.esoco.ewt.layout

Class GenericLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.ewt.layout.GenericLayout
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ContentLayout, DockLayout, EdgeLayout, FillLayout, FlowLayout, FluentCssLayout, ListLayout, MenuLayout, ScrollPanel.ScrollPanelLayout, SplitPanel.SplitPanelLayout, SwitchPanel.SwitchPanelLayout, TableGridLayout, TwoLayerLayout

    public abstract class GenericLayout
extends java.lang.Object
    Base class for all EWT layouts.

    • Method Detail

      • createLayoutContainer

        public abstract com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets createLayoutContainer(Container rContainer,
                                                                               StyleData rStyleData)
        Creates a new GWT container widget that represents this layout. This method is only intended to be used internally by the GEWT framework.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The GEWT container to create the widget for
        rStyleData - The style of the container widget
        Returns:
        A new widget container

      • addWidget

        public void addWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets rContainer,
                      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget rWidget,
                      StyleData rStyleData,
                      int nIndex)
        Adds a certain widget to a widget container according to this layout and the given style data. This default implementation ignores the style data and either invokes HasWidgets.remove(Widget) or, depending on the index and container type, InsertPanel.insert(Widget, int). Subclasses may override this method to implement a different layout strategy.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to add the widget to
        rWidget - The widget to add
        rStyleData - The style defining the layout position of the widget
        nIndex - The index to add the widget add (if supported by the implementation) or -1 to add as the last widget

      • clear

        public void clear(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets rContainer)
        Removes all widgets from this layout's container.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to clear

      • removeWidget

        public void removeWidget(com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.HasWidgets rContainer,
                         com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget rWidget)
        Removes a certain widget from a widget container according to this layout and the given style data. This default implementation just invokes the method HasWidgets.remove(Widget). Subclasses may override this method to implement a different layout strategy.
        Parameters:
        rContainer - The container to remove the widget from
        rWidget - The widget to remove

        sProperty - The name of the target property
